The Plott family bred these dogs for generations, developing them into fearless, tenacious big-game hounds capable of tracking and baying wild boar and black bear through the rugged Smoky Mountains. Standing 51–64 cm and weighing 18–27 kg, they are muscular, athletic hounds with a distinctive brindle coat (ranging from light to dark brindle with various markings) — the only hound breed where brindle is the preferred color. In 1989, the Plott Hound was designated the official state dog of North Carolina. They are brave, intelligent, and intensely loyal — they bond deeply with their families and can be protective. They have a clear, high-pitched voice that shifts to a distinctive 'chop' when they've treed game. Plotts are more serious and focused than many hound breeds, reflecting their heritage as determined big-game trackers rather than pack-running scent hounds.
description_el: Το Plott Hound είναι μοναδική αμερικανική ράτσα — το μόνο coonhound χωρίς αγγλική καταγωγή. Κατάγεται από γερμανικά Hanover Hounds που έφερε ο Johannes Georg Plott στη Βόρεια Καρολίνα το 1750. 51–64 εκ. και 18–27 κιλά, με χαρακτηριστικό brindle τρίχωμα. Επίσημο σκυλί πολιτείας Β. Καρολίνας από 1989. Θαρραλέα, έξυπνα, βαθιά πιστά. Πιο σοβαρά και εστιασμένα από πολλά hounds.
care_en: Plott Hounds need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 2 hours of vigorous activity including hiking, running, tracking, or hunting — and they have the endurance and drive of a dog bred for all-day mountain hunts. They are more intense and focused than many hound breeds and need an outlet for their energy and intelligence. Their short, smooth brindle coat is very low-maintenance, requiring only weekly brushing. Early socialization is extremely important — Plotts can be reserved or wary with strangers if not properly socialized. Training should be consistent and firm but fair — they are intelligent and willing to work but can be independent. They bond strongly with their primary handler and can be protective of their family and property. Secure fencing is essential — their prey drive and tracking instincts are powerful. They can be vocal with a distinctive treeing voice. They are best suited to experienced, active owners who understand working hound temperament.
care_el: Τα Plott Hound χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — 1 έως 2 ώρες. Εντονότερα από πολλά hounds. Χαμηλή συντήρηση τριχώματος. Πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση εξαιρετικά σημαντική. Σταθερή εκπαίδευση. Δένονται ισχυρά με τον ιδιοκτήτη. Ασφαλής περίφραξη. Φωνακλά. Καλύτερα με έμπειρους ιδιοκτήτες.
health_en: Plott Hounds are generally a healthy, hardy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–14 years, reflecting their heritage as tough working mountain dogs. Hip dysplasia is the primary orthopedic concern — OFA screening is recommended. Bloat (gastric dilatation-volvulus) can occur in this deep-chested breed — feeding smaller meals and avoiding exercise around mealtimes are prudent. Ear infections may develop, particularly in dogs that work in wet environments. Hypothyroidism has been occasionally reported. Eye conditions are uncommon but should be screened for. The breed has maintained relatively good genetic health due to its working heritage — breeders who hunt their dogs tend to select for vigor and stamina. Injuries from hunting (cuts, sprains, encounters with game) are common in working Plotts. Skin conditions may occur. The breed's moderate popularity helps maintain a reasonable gene pool. Regular veterinary care and proper nutrition support longevity. Responsible breeders screen for hips, elbows, eyes, and cardiac function.
health_el: Τα Plott Hound είναι γενικά υγιής, ανθεκτική ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–14 χρόνια. Δυσπλασία ισχίου κύρια ανησυχία. Φούσκωμα (GDV) πιθανό. Λοιμώξεις αυτιών. Υποθυρεοειδισμός αναφέρθηκε. Η κληρονομιά εργασίας διατήρησε καλή υγεία. Τραυματισμοί κυνηγιού κοινοί σε εργαζόμενα σκυλιά. Οι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν ισχία, αγκώνα, μάτια, καρδιά.

description_en: The Porcelaine is widely considered the oldest and most beautiful of the French scent hound breeds, named for its stunning, glossy white coat that gleams like fine French porcelain. Standing 53–58 cm and weighing 25–28 kg, this elegant, refined hound traces its ancestry back to the now-extinct Montaimboeuf, a white hound of medieval France, with possible contributions from English Harriers and Swiss Laufhunds. The breed nearly disappeared during the French Revolution when aristocratic hunting packs were destroyed, but was painstakingly reconstructed in the early 19th century by French and Swiss breeders. Their coat is a translucent white through which the underlying pink skin gives a porcelain-like glow, with small orange or lemon spots (particularly on the ears). They have long, thin, low-set ears, a finely chiseled head, and a noble, graceful bearing. Porcelaines are used for hunting hare, roe deer, and sometimes wild boar, typically in packs of six to twenty. They are friendly, affectionate, and gentle at home — they bond closely with their families and are good with children. In the field, they are energetic, determined trackers with a clear, melodious voice. They remain rare outside France and Switzerland.
description_el: Η Porcelaine θεωρείται η αρχαιότερη και ομορφότερη γαλλική ράτσα μυρωδιάς, ονομασμένη από το γυαλιστερό λευκό τρίχωμα που λάμπει σαν πορσελάνη. 53–58 εκ. και 25–28 κιλά. Σχεδόν εξαφανίστηκε στη Γαλλική Επανάσταση, ανακατασκευάστηκε τον 19ο αιώνα. Μεταφανές λευκό τρίχωμα με πορτοκαλί κηλίδες. Χρησιμοποιούνται για κυνήγι λαγού και ελαφιού σε αγέλες. Φιλικές, στοργικές, ήπιες. Σπάνιες εκτός Γαλλίας και Ελβετίας.
care_en: Porcelaines need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 1.5 hours of vigorous activity — and they are at their happiest when given opportunities for tracking and scent work. Their short, glossy coat is remarkably easy to maintain, requiring only weekly brushing and occasional bathing to maintain its characteristic porcelain sheen. Their thin, low-set ears should be cleaned regularly to prevent infections. Training is relatively cooperative for a scent hound — Porcelaines are willing to please and respond well to positive reinforcement, though they can become single-minded when they catch an interesting scent trail. Secure fencing is essential. They are pack-oriented dogs and thrive with canine companionship. They are gentle, affectionate family dogs that get along well with children. They can be vocal with a clear, carrying voice. They are not suited to urban apartment life — they need space and activity. Their white coat shows dirt easily, which is something potential owners should consider.
care_el: Οι Porcelaine χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — 1 έως 1,5 ώρες. Χαμηλή συντήρηση τριχώματος. Τα αυτιά πρέπει να καθαρίζονται τακτικά. Σχετικά συνεργάσιμες στην εκπαίδευση. Ασφαλής περίφραξη. Σκυλιά αγέλης — ευδοκιμούν με σύντροφο. Ήπια οικογενειακά σκυλιά. Φωνακλά. Δεν ταιριάζουν σε διαμέρισμα.
health_en: Porcelaines are generally a healthy, hardy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–14 years, benefiting from a long history of selection for working stamina. Hip dysplasia can occur — screening is recommended. Ear infections are possible due to their long ears — regular cleaning is important. Bloat (GDV) is a potential risk in this medium-large, deep-chested breed. Eye conditions are uncommon but occasional ectropion may occur. Hypothyroidism has been occasionally reported. The breed's very small population outside France means genetic diversity is a concern — French breed clubs maintain careful records to manage breeding. Skin sensitivity and sunburn can affect their white, thin-skinned coat — dogs with very sparse coat coverage should be protected from prolonged sun exposure. Regular veterinary check-ups and proper nutrition support their naturally robust health. Responsible breeders screen for hips, eyes, and are attentive to maintaining genetic health within the breed.
health_el: Οι Porcelaine είναι γενικά υγιής ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–14 χρόνια. Δυσπλασία ισχίου πιθανή. Λοιμώξεις αυτιών. Φούσκωμα (GDV) κίνδυνος. Εκτρόπιο σπάνιο. Μικρός πληθυσμός σημαίνει ανησυχία γενετικής ποικιλότητας. Ευαισθησία δέρματος και ηλιακό έγκαυμα πιθανά λόγω λευκού τριχώματος. Οι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν ισχία, μάτια.

description_en: The Redbone Coonhound is a strikingly beautiful American scent hound recognized for its gorgeous, solid deep-red coat — one of the only hound breeds with a uniform color. Standing 53–69 cm and weighing 20–32 kg, Redbones were developed in the late 18th century in the southern United States from red foxhounds brought by Scottish and Irish immigrants, refined over generations by coonhunters who selected for a flashy red coat, cold-trailing ability, and a melodious voice. They earned literary fame as the breed featured in Wilson Rawls' beloved 1961 novel 'Where the Red Fern Grows,' which introduced millions of readers to the devotion and courage of these hounds. Redbones are versatile hunters used for raccoon, bear, mountain lion, and deer, equally adept at tracking cold trails and swimming across rivers to follow game. They are among the most people-friendly of all coonhound breeds — outgoing, eager to please, and genuinely affectionate with their families. They have a sweet, mellow temperament at home and a distinctive, plaintive voice in the field. Their handsome appearance and agreeable personality have made them increasingly popular as family companions.
description_el: Το Redbone Coonhound είναι εντυπωσιακό αμερικανικό σκυλί μυρωδιάς με συμπαγές βαθύ κόκκινο τρίχωμα. 53–69 εκ. και 20–32 κιλά. Αναπτύχθηκε τον 18ο αιώνα στις νότιες ΗΠΑ. Κέρδισε λογοτεχνική φήμη στο 'Where the Red Fern Grows'. Ευέλικτοι κυνηγοί για ρακούν, αρκούδα, πούμα. Μεταξύ των πιο φιλικών coonhounds — εξωστρεφή, πρόθυμα, στοργικά. Γλυκιά, ήρεμη ιδιοσυγκρασία στο σπίτι.
care_en: Redbone Coonhounds need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 1.5 hours of vigorous walking, hiking, running, or ideally tracking and hunting — and they have impressive stamina built for all-day hunts. Secure fencing is absolutely essential, as their powerful nose and strong prey drive will lead them to follow scent trails with single-minded determination. Their short, smooth red coat is very low-maintenance, requiring only weekly brushing. Their long, pendulous ears must be checked and cleaned regularly to prevent infections. Redbones are among the more trainable coonhound breeds — they are eager to please and respond well to positive reinforcement with food rewards. Early socialization helps them develop their naturally friendly disposition. They are excellent with children and get along well with other dogs. They have a distinctive, melodious voice and can be vocal — their baying can carry considerable distance. They are affectionate, laid-back house dogs when properly exercised and love to be with their families.
care_el: Τα Redbone Coonhound χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — 1 έως 1,5 ώρες. Ασφαλής περίφραξη απολύτως απαραίτητη. Χαμηλή συντήρηση τριχώματος. Τα αυτιά πρέπει να καθαρίζονται τακτικά. Μεταξύ πιο εκπαιδεύσιμων coonhounds. Εξαιρετικά με παιδιά. Φωνακλά με μελωδική φωνή. Στοργικά στο σπίτι.
health_en: Redbone Coonhounds are generally a healthy, robust breed with a typical lifespan of 12–15 years. Hip dysplasia is the primary orthopedic concern — OFA screening is recommended. Ear infections are common due to their long, folded ears — regular cleaning is essential. Bloat (GDV) can occur in this deep-chested breed — feeding smaller meals is advisable. Eye conditions including ectropion and cherry eye have been occasionally reported. Hypothyroidism may develop. The breed can be prone to obesity if overfed and under-exercised, which exacerbates joint problems. Some Redbones may carry a gene for coonhound paralysis (idiopathic polyradiculoneuritis), a condition causing sudden onset weakness that typically resolves with supportive care. Allergies and skin conditions are uncommon but possible. The breed maintains good genetic diversity due to a healthy population of working dogs. Regular veterinary care, proper nutrition, and adequate exercise support their naturally robust health. Responsible breeders screen for hips, elbows, eyes, and cardiac function.
health_el: Τα Redbone Coonhound είναι γενικά υγιής ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–15 χρόνια. Δυσπλασία ισχίου κύρια ανησυχία. Λοιμώξεις αυτιών κοινές. Φούσκωμα (GDV) πιθανό. Οφθαλμικές παθήσεις σπάνιες. Παράλυση coonhound πιθανή — αυτοϊώμενη. Η ράτσα διατηρεί καλή γενετική ποικιλότητα. Οι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν ισχία, αγκώνα, μάτια, καρδιά.

description_en: The Rhodesian Ridgeback is a powerful, athletic hound developed in southern Africa (in what was then Rhodesia, now Zimbabwe) by European settlers who crossed their hunting dogs with the semi-wild ridged dogs of the indigenous Khoikhoi people. Standing 61–69 cm and weighing 32–41 kg, they are a large, muscular, wheaten-colored hound defined by their most distinctive feature: a symmetrical ridge of hair running along the spine in the opposite direction to the rest of the coat, formed by two crowns (whorls) at the top. Originally bred to track and bay lions — holding them at bay until the hunter arrived, never actually fighting them — Ridgebacks earned the nickname 'African Lion Hound.' They are also exceptional guard dogs and versatile hunting companions that were used to protect farms from predators and track game across vast African terrain. The breed standard was established in 1922 in Rhodesia. Ridgebacks are dignified, intelligent, loyal, and quietly confident — they are deeply devoted to their families and gentle with children they know, yet naturally reserved and watchful with strangers. They are one of the few hound breeds that also serves as an effective guardian. Their combination of athleticism, beauty, and noble character has made them one of the most popular hound breeds worldwide.
description_el: Το Rhodesian Ridgeback αναπτύχθηκε στη νότια Αφρική διασταυρώνοντας ευρωπαϊκά κυνηγετικά σκυλιά με τους ημι-άγριους ridged σκύλους των Khoikhoi. 61–69 εκ. και 32–41 κιλά, με χαρακτηριστική ράχη τριχών. Αρχικά εκτρεφόταν για να ιχνηλατεί και να κρατά λιοντάρια — «African Lion Hound». Εξαιρετικοί φύλακες. Πρότυπο ράτσας 1922. Αξιοπρεπή, έξυπνα, βαθιά πιστά — ήπια με τα παιδιά, συνεσταλμένα με ξένους. Από τις πιο δημοφιλείς ράτσες hound παγκοσμίως.
care_en: Rhodesian Ridgebacks need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 2 hours of vigorous walking, running, hiking, or lure coursing — and their athletic endurance means they can easily keep up with running or cycling owners. Their short, dense wheaten coat is one of the easiest of all breeds to maintain, requiring only weekly brushing and occasional bathing. Training requires a confident, consistent owner who establishes clear leadership through positive methods — Ridgebacks are intelligent but strong-willed and will test boundaries. Harsh training creates a resentful, stubborn dog; fair, firm, positive training creates a willing partner. Early, extensive socialization is absolutely essential — their natural reserve with strangers can become problematic shyness or aggression without proper exposure. They are naturally protective and make excellent watchdogs without specific guard training. They are gentle and patient with their own family's children but should be supervised with unfamiliar children due to their size and strength. They have relatively low prey drive for a hound breed but should still be supervised around small animals. They are quiet dogs that rarely bark without reason.
care_el: Τα Rhodesian Ridgeback χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — 1 έως 2 ώρες. Πολύ εύκολη συντήρηση τριχώματος. Η εκπαίδευση απαιτεί σίγουρο ιδιοκτήτη — θετικές μέθοδοι. Πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση απολύτως απαραίτητη. Φυσικά προστατευτικά. Ήπια με τα παιδιά. Ήσυχα σκυλιά που σπάνια γαβγίζουν χωρίς λόγο.
health_en: Rhodesian Ridgebacks have a typical lifespan of 10–12 years. The most significant breed-specific condition is dermoid sinus, a congenital defect where a tube-like channel of skin extends inward along the ridge — all puppies should be checked at birth and affected animals should not be bred. Hip and elbow dysplasia are significant orthopedic concerns — OFA screening is essential. Hypothyroidism is relatively common and manageable with medication. Degenerative myelopathy (DM) is a progressive spinal condition — DNA testing is available and breeding stock should be tested. Bloat (GDV) is a serious risk in this large, deep-chested breed — preventive gastropexy may be discussed with veterinarians. Mast cell tumors and other cancers occur at moderate rates. Eye conditions including entropion and cataracts may develop. Cardiac conditions have been reported. Juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME) has been identified in the breed — a DNA test is available. Regular veterinary monitoring and health screening are important. Responsible breeders screen for dermoid sinus, hips, elbows, eyes, thyroid, cardiac function, DM, and JME.
health_el: Τα Rhodesian Ridgeback έχουν τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 10–12 χρόνια. Dermoid sinus σημαντική συγγενής πάθηση. Δυσπλασία ισχίου/αγκώνα σημαντικές. Υποθυρεοειδισμός σχετικά κοινός. Εκφυλιστική μυελοπάθεια (DM) — DNA τεστ διαθέσιμο. Φούσκωμα (GDV) σοβαρός κίνδυνος. Καρκίνος σε μέτρια ποσοστά. Νεανική μυοκλονική επιληψία (JME) αναγνωρίστηκε. Οι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν ισχία, αγκώνα, μάτια, θυρεοειδή, καρδιά, DM, JME.

description_en: The Segugio Italiano (Italian Hound) is one of the oldest scent hound breeds in the world, with ancestry tracing back to ancient Egyptian coursing hounds that were brought to the Italian peninsula by Phoenician traders over 2,000 years ago — depictions of dogs resembling the modern Segugio appear in ancient Roman mosaics, sculptures, and Pompeian frescoes. Standing 48–58 cm and weighing 18–28 kg, they come in two coat varieties: the Segugio Italiano a Pelo Raso (short-haired) and the Segugio Italiano a Pelo Forte (wire-haired), in colors of fawn, black and tan, or tricolor. They are the most popular and widely used hunting dog in Italy, employed both individually and in packs for tracking hare and wild boar through Italy's varied terrain from Alpine forests to Mediterranean scrubland. The Segugio is an extraordinarily devoted and affectionate companion at home — they form deep, intense bonds with their owners and are gentle, calm house dogs. In the field, they transform into passionate, relentless trackers with one of the finest noses in dogdom and a distinctive, musical baying voice that Italian hunters prize. Their elegant, lean build and expressive dark eyes give them a noble, soulful appearance.
description_el: Το Segugio Italiano είναι μία από τις αρχαιότερες ράτσες μυρωδιάς, με καταγωγή 2.000+ ετών — εμφανίζεται σε ρωμαϊκά μωσαϊκά και τοιχογραφίες Πομπηίας. 48–58 εκ. και 18–28 κιλά, σε κοντότριχη και τραχύτριχη ποικιλία. Το δημοφιλέστερο κυνηγετικό σκυλί στην Ιταλία, για λαγό και αγριογούρουνο. Εξαιρετικά αφοσιωμένοι και στοργικοί στο σπίτι. Στο πεδίο, παθιασμένοι ιχνηλάτες με μελωδική φωνή. Κομψή, αρχοντική εμφάνιση.
care_en: Segugio Italiano need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 1.5 hours of vigorous walking, hiking, or tracking activities — and they have the stamina for extended hunts across challenging terrain. They are remarkably calm, gentle, and well-behaved indoors when properly exercised — many Italian owners describe them as 'living room hounds' that love to sleep on the sofa next to their owner. The short-haired variety needs minimal grooming (weekly brushing), while the wire-haired variety requires more attention including occasional hand-stripping. Ear cleaning is important for both varieties. Training is relatively straightforward — Segugi are intelligent and eager to bond with their handler, responding well to positive reinforcement and gentle guidance. They are sensitive dogs that do not respond well to harsh methods. Secure fencing is recommended as their hunting instinct is strong. They are deeply social and can develop separation anxiety if left alone too long. They form intense bonds and are sometimes described as 'velcro dogs' — always wanting to be near their person.
care_el: Τα Segugio Italiano χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — 1 έως 1,5 ώρες. Αξιοσημείωτα ήρεμα εσωτερικά. Κοντότριχη: ελάχιστη περιποίηση· τραχύτριχη: stripping. Σχετικά εύκολη εκπαίδευση. Ευαίσθητα — δεν ανταποκρίνονται σε σκληρές μεθόδους. Ασφαλής περίφραξη. Βαθιά κοινωνικά — μπορεί να αναπτύξουν άγχος αποχωρισμού. «Velcro dogs».
health_en: Segugio Italiano are generally a healthy, robust breed with a typical lifespan of 11–13 years, benefiting from millennia of natural and working selection. Hip dysplasia can occur but is less common than in many other breeds of similar size — screening is still recommended. Ear infections may develop, particularly in the wire-haired variety with denser ear furnishings. Bloat (GDV) is a potential risk in this deep-chested breed. Eye conditions are uncommon but should be monitored. Hypothyroidism has been occasionally reported. The breed maintains excellent genetic diversity in Italy due to its enormous working population. Skin conditions and allergies are uncommon. They tend to be lean, athletic dogs that maintain healthy weight with proper exercise — obesity is less of a concern than in some hound breeds. Field injuries (cuts, sprains) are common in working dogs. Regular veterinary care and proper nutrition support their naturally vigorous health. Responsible breeders screen for hips, eyes, and cardiac function.
health_el: Τα Segugio Italiano είναι γενικά υγιής, ανθεκτική ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 11–13 χρόνια. Δυσπλασία ισχίου λιγότερο κοινή. Λοιμώξεις αυτιών πιθανές. Φούσκωμα (GDV) κίνδυνος. Εξαιρετική γενετική ποικιλότητα στην Ιταλία. Αθλητικά σκυλιά που διατηρούν υγιές βάρος. Τραυματισμοί πεδίου κοινοί σε εργαζόμενα σκυλιά. Οι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν ισχία, μάτια, καρδιά.

description_en: The Treeing Walker Coonhound is the most popular and widely used coonhound breed in the United States, developed from Walker Foxhounds (themselves descended from the English Foxhound) in the mid-20th century. Standing 51–69 cm and weighing 20–32 kg, they are a sleek, athletic, tricolor hound with a classic white, black, and tan coat that has earned them the nickname 'the people's choice' among coonhound enthusiasts. The breed's development was heavily influenced by a stolen dog of unknown origin called 'Tennessee Lead' in the 1850s, who was crossed into the Walker Foxhound line and produced offspring with exceptional treeing instinct and speed. Treeing Walkers are named for their hunting style — they trail raccoons with incredible speed and agility, then 'tree' them (drive them up a tree and bay at the base until the hunter arrives), with a distinctive change in voice from trailing to treeing that experienced hunters can read from great distances. They are among the most intelligent and trainable of the coonhound breeds — friendly, confident, and eager to work. Off the hunt, they are affectionate, outgoing family dogs that get along well with children and other dogs. They are considered the 'athletes' of the coonhound world — fast, agile, and competitive.
description_el: Το Treeing Walker Coonhound είναι το πιο δημοφιλές coonhound στις ΗΠΑ, αναπτυγμένο από Walker Foxhounds. 51–69 εκ. και 20–32 κιλά, κομψό τρίχρωμο. Επηρεάστηκε από τον 'Tennessee Lead' τη δεκαετία 1850. Ονομάστηκε από το στυλ κυνηγιού — ιχνηλατεί ρακούν και τα ανεβάζει σε δέντρα. Μεταξύ πιο ευφυών coonhounds — φιλικά, σίγουρα. Στοργικά οικογενειακά σκυλιά. Θεωρούνται οι «αθλητές» του κόσμου coonhound.
care_en: Treeing Walker Coonhounds need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 2 hours of vigorous activity — and they are among the most athletic and high-energy of all hound breeds. They excel at coonhound field trials, nite hunts, agility, and any activity that channels their speed and intelligence. Secure, tall fencing is absolutely essential — Treeing Walkers are remarkably athletic and can scale surprisingly tall fences when motivated by prey drive. Their short, smooth coat is very low-maintenance, requiring only weekly brushing. Their pendant ears should be cleaned regularly. They are among the most intelligent and trainable coonhound breeds — they are eager to please and respond enthusiastically to positive reinforcement, especially food rewards. They are friendly, social dogs that get along well with children, other dogs, and even strangers. They have a loud, distinctive baying voice that changes character from trailing to treeing — this is prized by hunters but can be problematic in residential neighborhoods. They need both physical exercise and mental stimulation to be happy. They are affectionate, loyal companions that want to be part of the family.
care_el: Τα Treeing Walker Coonhound χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — 1 έως 2 ώρες. Μεταξύ πιο αθλητικών hounds. Ασφαλής, ψηλή περίφραξη απαραίτητη. Χαμηλή συντήρηση τριχώματος. Τα αυτιά πρέπει να καθαρίζονται. Μεταξύ πιο εκπαιδεύσιμων coonhounds. Φιλικά, κοινωνικά. Δυνατή φωνή. Στοργικά οικογενειακά σκυλιά.
health_en: Treeing Walker Coonhounds are generally a healthy, hardy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–13 years. Hip dysplasia is the primary orthopedic concern — OFA screening is recommended. Ear infections are common due to their long, folded ears — regular cleaning is essential. Bloat (GDV) can occur in this deep-chested breed. Eye conditions including ectropion and cherry eye have been occasionally reported. Hypothyroidism may develop. Coonhound paralysis (idiopathic polyradiculoneuritis), potentially triggered by raccoon bites, causes sudden onset weakness and is more common in working coonhounds — it typically resolves with supportive care over several weeks. Allergies and skin conditions are uncommon but possible. The breed maintains good genetic diversity due to its large working population. Field injuries are common in hunting dogs. They tend to maintain athletic condition with proper exercise, though their food motivation means weight management requires attention. Regular veterinary care supports their robust health. Responsible breeders screen for hips, eyes, and cardiac function.
health_el: Τα Treeing Walker Coonhound είναι γενικά υγιής ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–13 χρόνια. Δυσπλασία ισχίου κύρια ανησυχία. Λοιμώξεις αυτιών κοινές. Φούσκωμα (GDV) πιθανό. Παράλυση coonhound — πιθανώς από δαγκώματα ρακούν. Η ράτσα διατηρεί καλή γενετική ποικιλότητα. Τραυματισμοί πεδίου κοινοί. Αθλητική κατάσταση. Οι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν ισχία, μάτια, καρδιά.
